newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HP unit signs HK$45 mln deal with HK government.
newsitem.headline: HP unit signs HK$45 mln deal with HK government.

text.p: Hewlett-Packard Co's Hong Kong unit signed a HK$45 million turnkey contract with the local government on the provision of information equipment and services to the police force.

Under the deal, the contractor will supply almost 200 UNIX and Windows NT servers, about 3,000 personal computers and more than 2,500 printers to the police over the next three years, a statement by the local government said.
In addition to hardware and software, the contract also covers a comprehensive suite of services, the police said.
The contract will provide the police with a foundation of information systems to manage a broad range of operations at all levels, the police added.
